sub_topic: Find the Levi-Civita connection of a given metric.
message_1:
Consider the following metric: 

$$ds^2 = 4(dx^2 + dy^2) + 9dz^2$$ 

Find the Levi-Civita connection of the given metric at $P(1,1,1)$.\

(Note: you may also specify the coordinate system in which the metric is written)
message_2:
The given metric can be written in matrix form as:

$$g = \begin{pmatrix} 4 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 4 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 9 \end{pmatrix}$$

The Levi-Civita connection is given by the Christoffel symbols, which can be calculated using the following formula:

$$\Gamma^k_{ij} = \frac{1}{2} g^{kl} (\partial_i g_{lj} + \partial_j g_{il} - \partial_l g_{ij})$$

where $g^{kl}$ is the inverse of the metric tensor $g_{kl}$. In this case, the inverse metric tensor is:

$$g^{-1} = \begin{pmatrix} 1/4 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1/4 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1/9 \end{pmatrix}$$

Now, we can compute the Christoffel symbols. Since the metric tensor is diagonal and constant, its derivatives with respect to the coordinates are all zero:

$$\partial_i g_{lj} = \partial_j g_{il} = \partial_l g_{ij} = 0$$

Thus, the Christoffel symbols are all zero:

$$\Gamma^k_{ij} = 0$$

So, the Levi-Civita connection of the given metric at any point, including $P(1,1,1)$, is zero. This means that the given metric is flat, and the coordinate system is Cartesian coordinates.
